episodes.title: #57 TDP “Psychological Manipulation in Cults” featuring Syran Warner - Grace Lauren Taylor
episodes.description: Send us a Text Message. Our guest this week is journalist Syran Warner shares his insight on how Cults often use trauma as a tool for psychological manipulation, exploiting individuals' vulnerabilities to gain control and influence. By creating or exacerbating emotional distress, cult leaders can foster dependency, loyalty, and obedience, making it difficult for members to leave or question the group's practices and beliefs. Make sure you go check them out after the episode and show them some love His TikTok is @SyranWarner and his Instagram is @freemelissaparker Resources: Here are some resources that can help individuals looking to escape a cult and support their recovery: Organizations and Support Groups International Cultic Studies Association (ICSA) Website: www.icsahome.com Offers educational resources, support groups, and referrals to mental health professionals. Cult Education Institute Website: www.culteducation.com Provides information on various cults, news updates, and support resources. Freedom of Mind Resource Center Website: www.freedomofmind.com Founded by Steven Hassan, this organization offers resources for understanding mind control, recovery, and support. Recovering From Religion Website: www.recoveringfromreligion.org Provides support for individuals leaving religious cults through peer support, counseling, and resources. Books "Combating Cult Mind Control" by Steven Hassan A comprehensive guide on understanding cults and recovering from their influence. "Cults in Our Midst: The Continuing Fight Against Their Hidden Menace" by Margaret Thaler Singer and Janja Lalich Offers insights into the psychological manipulation used by cults and recovery strategies.
